title: Calories in a Cider Donut
meta_description: Discover calories in cider donut, including full nutrition breakdown like carbs, fat, protein, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard cider donut (~70 g), fried in oil, cinnamon-sugar coated, made with apple cider; no fillings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, size, frying method, and recipe. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cider donut has about 250 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one cider donut?
faqs.a: Approximately 250 kcal for a standard size.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a cider donut?
faqs.a: About 35 g carbs, including 15 g sugars and 1 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is a cider donut high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, around 12 g total fat, with 5 g saturated.

faqs.q: How does baking affect calories in cider donut?
faqs.a: Baking reduces calories by ~80 kcal compared to frying.
Typically not; check for wheat flour, but some recipes use alternatives.
